abstract: Aspiring political consultant Austin Wright hopes to find curator for trove of political memorabilia left behind by his father Jordan M Wright, who died in 2008; Wright hopes to maintain integrity of collection, which is controlled by his father's nonprofit organization the Museum of Democracy; costs of cataloging items and prospect of founding institution have proved daunting.
lead_paragraph: An enormous collection of political memorabilia has been languishing in storage since its creator died, and his family and curators are seeking a way to organize and display thousands of treasures.

byline.contributor: Elisa Cho and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
